sk.net

Class SKServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • sk.net.SKServer

  • public class SKServer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used for hosting a server with SKNet.
    Author:
    Alfred Sporre

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public SKServer start()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Starts all the underlying server threads.
        Returns:
        this server instance
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the server socket could not be opened
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there are no packet listeners associated with this server

        Removes the connection with the specified id from this server's client list.
        Parameters:
        id - - the id
        Returns:
        false if there is no connection associated with the provided id

      • close

        protected SKServer close(int clientID,
                         boolean local,
                         java.lang.String msg)
        Closes the socket of the specified client.
        Parameters:
        clientID - - the id of the client whose connection to close
        local - - true if the disconnection was fired locally
        msg - - the disconnection message
        Returns:
        this server instance

        Parameters:
        hostname - - the host name of the server

        Returns:
        this server instance

        Returns:
